intro: Phyllanthus scabrellus, commonly known as the rough phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and rough, often hairy leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a distinctive, rough texture. Phyllanthus scabrellus is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in forested or disturbed habitats.
